alert.note: Alert for Buena Vista (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 24 at 10:35PM CDT until June 24 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN BUENA VISTA COUNTY... At 1034 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Newell, or 9 miles east of Storm Lake, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Buena Vista County, in areas north of Newell by 1040 pm. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN
info.instruction: Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
